#Text=Gloucester ( Massachusetts )
#Text=Gloucester is a city in Massachusetts .
#Text=One of the country 's oldest settlements , established in 1623 , it serves as America 's oldest seaport .
#Text=Although the sea is contributing less to the city 's economy , Gloucester is still a true New England fishing center as immortalized in the movie The Perfect Storm .
#Text=Rocky Neck , the longest continually operating art colony in North America , is also in Gloucester .
#Text=Get in
#Text=Gloucester is America 's oldest seaport . Established in 1623 , the city 's roots are tied to the sea .
#Text=Even with the decline of fishing due to heavy federal regulations , the city has an active waterfront .
#Text=It also hosts great museums and sites .

#Text=The Cape Ann Museum has the largest collection of Fitz Henry Lane paintings in the country , Hammond Castle , built by John Hayes Hammond , the father of remote control , Beauport , built by Henry Sleeper and a National Historic Landmark , the Sargent House , home of Judith Singer Sargent , one of the country 's first feminists and the Gloucester Maritime Heritage Center , telling the story of the fishing industry and featuring the oldest continuously working railways in the country .
#Text=Gloucester 's City Hall was built in 1871 and has examples of the finest WPA murals in Massachusetts .
#Text=Gloucester also features a diverse selection of fine restaurants and a delightful downtown .
#Text=By car
#Text=From Boston take I-93 or Route 1 to Route 128 .
#Text=It 's about 35 mi ( 56 km ) .
#Text=By train
#Text=The MBTA commuter rail runs from North Station in Boston to Gloucester via the Newburyport/Rockport line .
#Text=The trip takes about an hour and costs $ 7.25 one-way .
#Text=By bus
#Text=Cape Ann Transportation Authority , ( CATA ) , phone : +1 978-283-7916 , , runs buses on Cape Ann including special routes during the summer .
#Text=Get around
#Text=Gloucester Visitor Information Center , off Rt . 127 at Stage Fort Park , Phone : +1 978-281-8865 .
#Text=Seasonal .
#Text=Get a free brochure on the Gloucester Maritime Trail which describes four self-guided walks .
#Text=See

#Text=Fisherman 's Memorial Statue , Stacy Blvd. Iconic statue of a typical storm-dressed " Old Salt " at the wheel commemorating the over ten thousand Gloucester fishermen who have been lost at sea .
#Text=Rocky Neck Art Colony , Rocky Neck Av. off East Main .
#Text=The oldest art colony in America , with galleries of local artists , bars and restaurants .
#Text=Do

#Text=Gloucester was voted " Top 5 whale watching destinations in the World " by the World Wildlife Fund as several species of whales migrate to the shores of Gloucester every year to feed on the abundant natural resources .

#Text=Whale watching enthusiasts can expect to potentially see humpback whales , northern right whales , minke whales , blue whales , fin whales , sperm whales , pilot whales among other whale species .
#Text=Cape Ann Whale Watch , 415 Main St , ☏ +1978 283-5110 , toll-free : +1 800 877-5110 , ✉ whale.watch@verizon.net . 7AM-7PM daily .
#Text=Offering guaranteed whale sightings on all tours .
#Text=Departing twice daily for over 35 years , Cape Ann Whale Watch sails aboard
#Text=" The Hurricane II " , made famous in the 1991 movie The Perfect Storm . $ 48.00 .
#Text=Hammond Castle , 80 Hesperus Ave , ☏ +1978 283-2080 .
#Text=Castle overlooking the Atlantic Ocean since 1929 , now a museum open to the public , once served as John Hayes Hammond , Jr 's laboratory and home , inventor and pioneer of remote control .
#Text=Hammond held over 400 patents and built a weather chamber in his home where he tried to control rain , snow , sleet and wind inside his lab .
#Text=Stage Fort Park The site of the city 's first establishment , with giant bronze plaque to prove it , the fort retains the original cannons used for defense pointing towards Gloucester Harbor .
#Text=A good place to enjoy a picnic , have a swim at two of the parks beaches , or wander through the maze of stone step remains of the original fort .
#Text=Gloucester 's Visitor and Welcoming Center is also found here .
#Text=Coastal Fishing Charters , 417 Main St , ☏ +1508 284-2909 , toll-free : +1 800 877-5110 .
#Text=7AM-7PM daily .
#Text=In business since the 1980s offering bluefin tuna fishing charters aboard a classic 35-ft ( 11-m ) boat .
#Text=Featured in reality TV series Wicked Tuna .
#Text=Buy
#Text=The main downtown area of Gloucester holds a number of local shops and restaurants for many tastes .
#Text=Although the downtown area has lost the department stores it used to have , many new shops and eateries have opened .
#Text=The area is a pleasant walk around , and it 's easy to drop in and visit shops for Souvenirs , such as the Weathervane and the House of the Raven .
#Text=The area is changing daily , into a more tourist friendly venue for visitors attracted to a still operational fishing port .

#Text=Although the city has suffered from the loss of the fishing industry , residents have moved towards recognizing other avenues that the city can survive economically , including tourism , while still maintaining the active fishing community .

#Text=The main street area has begun sprouting condos downtown , and a new retail spot has arisen in the former Browns Mall , where the Green Life Natural Living Store , and a kitchen specialty store are new additions to the retail scene .
#Text=There is a sporting goods store called Palazolas , as well as a few bookshops , and antiques stores .

#Text=For more typical needs beyond souvenirs and an enjoyable downtown section , there are two main plazas in town , one on Eastern Avenue , and one on Bass Avenue which hold supermarkets and drug stores , along with other outlets .
#Text=House of the Raven ( House of Raven ) , 141 Main St. , ☏ +1 978-281-1624 .
#Text=M - F 10:10AM-5:30PM , Sa till 5PM .
#Text=Custom picture framing on-site .
#Text=Master framer with 30 years experience .
#Text=Fine gold , sterling silver jewelry , gifts , cards , and souvenirs .
#Text=Eat
#Text=Latitude 43 , 25 Rogers St , ☏ +1 978-281-0223 .
#Text=11:30 AM- 1 AM .
#Text=Coastal cuisine with a modern twist .
#Text=Award-winning sushi in a sunken in sushi pit .
#Text=Breakfast
#Text=Sugar Magnolias , 112 Main Street ( downtown ) , ☏ +1978 281-5310 .
#Text=This is one of the most popular places for breakfast in town , fresh , interesting takes on breakfast foods .
#Text=Morning Glory , 25 Western Ave , ☏ +1978 281-1851 .
#Text=Has an outdoor deck overlooking the harbor on Stacy 's Boulevard .
#Text=Charlie 's Place , 83 Bass Avenue , ☏ +1978 281-5002 .
#Text=Serves a nice breakfast , inexpensive .
#Text=Two Sisters Coffee Shop , 27 Washington Street , ☏ +1978 281-3378 .
#Text=Have some nice Swedish Nisu bread .
